intro: Ophryosporus lorentzii, commonly known as the Lorentz's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
